author: Internet Desk
title: TCS's Chandrasekaran is Tata Sons new Chairman
text:
12  19 IST more-in 
Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer N Chandrasekaran has been appointed as the Chairman of Tata Sons. 
Tata Sons has been involved in an ongoing battle with Cyrus Mistry after he was abruptly removed as Chairman on October 24, 2016. 
Who is N. Chandrasekaran 
Born in an agricultural family, his father, Srinivasan Natarajan, was a lawyer by profession, but managed the family farm. 
Chandrasekaran studied in a Tamil-medium government school initially and graduated from the Coimbatore Institute of Technology with a degree in Applied Sciences. 
He has a postgraduate degree in computer applications from the Regional Engineering College, Tiruchi. 
From there, he joined TCS in 1987, and moved up the ladder to become its CEO and Managing Director. In addition to taking TCS to higher glory, Chandra has also often been the flag bearer for the Indian IT sector in many international forums. Tata Sons feud: A timeline 
Oct. 24: Cyrus Mistry removed as Tata Sons Chairman. Ratan Tata appointed interim Chairman for four months 

Oct. 26: Cyrus Mistry levels series of allegations against Ratan Tata in a letter to Tata Sons board; Says he was pushed into a position of 'lame duck' chairman. 

Nov. 1: Ratan Tata writes to employees that Tata Sons board felt Mistry's removal was 'absolutely necessary' for the future success of the Tata Group. 

Nov 9: TCS sacks Cyrus Mistry as TCS Chairman; Ishaat Hussain replaces him. 

Nov. 15: Tata Global Beverages sacks Mistry as Chairman; Harish Bhat takes over 

Nov 21: Nusli Wadia, independent director of Tata Steel, Tata Motors and Tata Chemicals served defamation notice by Tata Sons board 

Nov 25: Tata Steel removes Mistry as Chairman, appoints independent director O P Bhatt in his place 

Dec 5: Mistry seeks government intervention to 'remedy and repair breakdown' in the governance of trusts managing Tata Sons 

Dec 13: TCS EGM removes Mistry as director 

Dec 19: Mistry quits as director from boards of key operating Tata companies before scheduled EGMs, describes his sacking from Tata Sons as 'illegal coup' 

Dec 20: Mistry moves NCLT against Ratan Tata, Tata Sons and some of its directors 

Dec 23: Ratan Tata says 'however painful' the fight with Mistry may be but 'the truth will prevail' 

Dec 27: Tata Sons slaps legal notice on Mistry for alleged breach of confidentiality 
January 12: CS CEO Chandrasekaran replaces Ratan Tata as Chairman of Tata Sons. 
(with inputs from BusinessLine)
